title: Which is the best alternative to Grammarly? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a number of alternatives, but prior to choosing one or another, you need to determine your goals. You need fast and reliable suggestions, or you want to have rich WYSIWYG editor, plagiarism checking, is privacy among your concerns or not. For example, let's take Textly.AI – it is and a grammar checker which has privacy and content creation features included, meaning it does not only check what you've written, but helps you to get an inspiration (you can use its library of content templates) and protects your data via pastebin mode (works like secret chat on messaging app), and you can use its Chrome and Firefox extensions without the need to create an account.

The preferable alternative to Grammarly is an actual proofreader or copy editor! Computers cannot read what humans can, which is why Google Analytics, etc, require codes and algorithms to understand web pages. To edit a language properly, you need to use a human! Spellchecks and grammar checks will pick out the things a computer can understand, but only an actual person will know things about actual usage, colloquial terms, language used in certain areas, vernacular and things such as when it’s alright to mention certain groups. Grammarly is the cheap and easy way out for anyone trying to edit or proofread their work, and the mistakes will be noticed! So use a professional!
